name: UP768201: Roomba Number Five!
description:
In Roomba Number Five, you play as a friendly cleaning bot called Roomberto. Roomberto procrastinated a little too much and now he has to make a mad dash across his master's suspiciously large and linear house, cleaning up dirt and avoiding pesky furniture as he goes.

Simply click and drag the mouse to navigate throughout the level.

Be warned though, you'll need to collect batteries to keep Roomberto going, or he'll get a bit fed up and you'll make him very sad, violating like 6 clauses of the Geneva convention or whatever.

This game was made in Unity 5, using ProBuilder, ProGrids, Post-Processing Stack and various colour correction profiles.

All 3d artwork was taken from the Google Poly website. They are distributed by Poly by Google and come with a commercial use/remix license.

The font used in the game is The Kids Mraker, a font that's free for both personal and commercial use. https://www.dafont.com/the-kids-mraker.font?text=Roomba+Number+Five

The music used is taken from the Free Music Archive. https://freemusicarchive.blob.core.windows.net/storage-freemusicarchive-org/music/none_given/Rolemusic/Rolemusic_-_Singles/Rolemusic_-_02_-_May.mp3

The sound effects used were generated with BFXR, a free for commercial use sound effects generator.
